<h3 id="X49">X(49)&nbsp;=&nbsp;CENTER OF SINE-TRIPLE-ANGLE CIRCLE</h3>
Trilinears&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cos 3A : cos 3B : cos 3C
<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp;sin A cos 3A : sin B cos 3B : sin C cos 3C
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a^4 (a^2 - b^2 - c^2) (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 - 2 a^2 b^2 - 2 a^2 c^2 - b^2 c^2) : :
<br>
<b>
X(49) = (r<sup>2</sup> + 2 r R+ s<sup>2</sup>)*X(1) - 6 R (R + r)*X(2) - 3(r<sup>2</sup> + 4 r R + R<sup>2</sup> - s<sup>2</sup>)*X(3) &nbsp;&nbsp; (Peter Moses, April 2, 2013)

</b>
<p><b>
V. Thebault,</b> "Sine-triple-angle-circle," <i>Mathesis</i> 65 (1956) 282-284.
</p>
<p>
X(49) lies on these lines: {1,215}, {2,13353}, {3,155}, {4,156}, {5,54}, {6,7506}, {10,9701}, {20,18882}, {22,16266}, {23,10263}, {24,568}, {25,36749}, {26,1993}, {30,1614}, {39,9603}, {40,9586}, {34577,50708}, {34780,44679}, {34786,40276}, {35001,52100}, {35324,41334}, {37475,45248}, {37486,37672}, {37496,47748}, {37509,44085}, {38224,39834}, {38260,43908}, {38723,44240}, {38728,43617}, {41335,50433}, {41586,44322}, {41628,44213}, {43584,43600}, {43603,43804}, {43650,46219}, {43815,50979}, {43863,46688}, {43864,46689}, {43894,44218}, {44078,51519}, {44259,44752}, {44829,51392}, {45016,50649}
</p>
<p>
Suppose that P and Q are distinct points in the plane of a triangle ABC .  Let P<sub>A</sub> = reflection of P in line AQ, let Q<sub>A</sub> = reflection of Q in line AP, and let M<sub>A</sub> = midpoint of segment P<sub>A</sub>Q<sub>A</sub>.  Define M<sub>B</sub> and M<sub>C</sub> cyclically.  CÃ©sar Lozada found that if Q = isogonal conjugate of P, then the locus of P for which M<sub>A</sub>M<sub>B</sub>M<sub>C</sub> is perspective to ABC is the union of a cubic and 6 circles:  specifically, the McCay cubic (K003), the circles {B,C,B',C'}}, {C,A,C',A'}}, {A,B,A',B'}}, and the circles {B,C,A'}}, {C,A,B'}}, {A,B,C'}}, where A',B',C' are the excenters of ABC.  Moreover, if P = X(3) and Q = X(4), then M<sub>A</sub>M<sub>B</sub>M<sub>C</sub> is not only perspective, but homothetic, to ABC, and the center of homothety is X(49).
See <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=23265">Hyacinthos 23265, June 1, 2015.</a>
</p>
<p>
X(49) is the {X(54),X(110)}-harmonic conjugate of X(5). For a list of other harmonic conjugates of X(49), click <b>Tables</b> at the top of this page.
</p>
<p>
X(49) = isogonal conjugate of X(93)<br>
X(49) = isotomic conjugate of X(20572)<br>
X(49) = anticomplement of X(34826)<br>
X(49) = X(4)-isoconjugate of X(2962)<br>
X(49) = X(92)-isoconjugate of X(2963)<br>
X(49) = eigencenter of cevian triangle of X(94)<br>
X(49) = eigencenter of anticevian triangle of X(50)<br>
X(49) = X(94)-Ceva conjugate of X(50)<br>
X(49) = anticomplement of X(34826)<br>
X(49) = circumcircle inverse of X(14889)<br>
X(49) = {X(i),X(j)}-harmonic conjugate of X(k) for these (i,j,k): {2, 32046, 13353}, {3, 1147, 22115}, {3, 155, 18436}, {3, 18445, 34783}, {3, 43807, 43604}, {3, 50461, 5562}, {3, 9703, 1147}, {3, X(49) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these {i,j}: {3, 13367}, {5, 15806}, {3520, 43394}, {7488, 5944}, {37495, 34148}<br>

X(49) = barycentric product X(i)*X(j) for these (i, j): {2, 49}, {3, 1994}, {6, 44180}, {61, 52349}, {62, 52348}, {63, 2964}, {69, 2965}, {97, 143}, {184, 7769}, {248, 51440}, {343, 25044}, {394, 3518}, {577, 32002}, {648, 37084}, {1493, 31626}, {1510, 4558}, {11126, 50469}, {11127, 50468}, {14129, 19210}, {15958, 20577}, {22115, 30529}, {32661, 41298}<br>
X(49) = barycentric quotient X(i)*X(j) for these (i, j): {2, 20572}, {3, 11140}, {6, 93}, {48, 2962}, {49, 2}, {50, 562}, {110, 38342}, {143, 324}, {184, 2963}, {216, 25043}, {571, 14111}, {577, 3519}, {1493, 40684}, {1510, 14618}, {1994, 264}, {2964, 92}, {2965, 4}, {3518, 2052}, {4558, 46139}, {7769, 18022}, {9380, 19552}, {14533, 252}, {14577, 13450}, {14585, 51477}, {25044, 275}, {30529, 18817}, {32002, 18027}, {32661, 930}, {34418, 9381}, {37084, 525}, {44180, 76}, {44809, 44427}, {51440, 44132}, {52348, 34390}, {52349, 34389}, {52417, 14165}
